about_the_game:
You find yourself in a pitch-dark world. Avoid dangerous events, restore memory, and escape from the “Mystery Zone”.

"From The Mystery Zone” is a short first-person minesweeper game.


【Difficulty Level】
  • There will be major changes to the difficulty level immediately after the game's release. For details, please see the "Adjustments" at the bottom of the description.
    You can adjust the number of dangerous events.
    You can adjust the level of difficulty from beginner to expert minesweeper players.

    【Play time】
    60 minutes or more (depending on the difficulty)
    If you are not good at Minesweeper or find it difficult, please lower the difficulty.
    Also, Minesweeper cannot be solved completely and there is an element of luck involved.


    【Rules】
    “00”, “21”, “62”…Numbers in the grid
    The right side of the number indicates the number of dangerous events around you.
    　If the number is “03”, there are 3 dangerous events in the surrounding 8 squares.
    The left side of the number indicates the current hierarchy?

    【Dangerous events】
    Do not touch.
    Do not examine.
    Do not walk over it.
    Flagging is easy to understand.

    【Goal】
    Restore memory

    Space: Jump.
    Left click: Check a grid.
    Right click: Flag a grid.
    Q: Open Menu


    "Adjustments 2024/06/28"
    ・There was a bug where an event that resets your progress would occur when you got a game over.
    We fixed this in the last patch so that it wouldn't happen, and we've made it a feature from this version onwards.
    This has made the game more difficult.

    ・The algorithm for placing events (bombs) has been changed.
    To reduce the element of luck, the first square is now always set to "0".
    Also, if you haven't taken any damage, you can return to stage selection without initializing your data by selecting "Return to Title" from the menu.

    ・Details of the algorithm for placing events (bombs)
    In the previous version, the part that was automatically generated is now created so that a path from the start to the goal is created, and events (bombs) are not placed on that path.
